titleInfo.title: Letter to William Hornby, President and Governor, Council at Bombay, from John Beaumont at Bushire

physicalDescription.extent: The item is damaged and has several holes in the text.

mods.abstract: Letter discusses administrative and financial matters in detail including a lengthy discussion of the woolens trade. It is stated that Bussora [Basra] has provided Beaumont with a copy of the phirmaund [firman] that George Abraham obtained from Carim Caun [Karim Khan] in August 1776.A list estimating cloth sales annually at Bushire and a translation of the phirmaund recieved from Karim Khan are included in the file after the letter.
